Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the money
Reviews.Author: P. Elosser
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth or fifth Canon digital P&S;, over the years I've worn all the others out. This one has lived up to my expectations of Canon quality. All the controls do take a bit of experimentation to figure out, but you can leave it on AUTO and let the camera do all the work. The only disadvantage for me, there is no manual control of shutter speed and F-stop. However, in P mode you can index the exposure (+/-) and set the ISO speed for some creativity. The pre-programed modes have a good variety and they all basically work giving you the desired effects. Image quality is excellent IMHO for any P&S; camera in this price range. There is almost no difference in image quality between ISO 100 and 200. ISO 400 begins to show a tiny bit of noise or artifacts. ISO 800 and 1600 do show some noise but it looks to me like the camera automatically despeckles the picture, which eliminates most of the noise but noticeably softens the focus. Close focus mode works accurately. A couple of hints: First, set the camera to ISO 100 (rather than AUTO ISO) and you will get great pictures in most lighting conditions. Second, learn to use the white balance for the appriate lighting conditions (sunlight, cloudy, tungsten, etc.) Although the auto white balance works, it often won't work as well as setting it for the proper balance. Also, learn to set the flash functions. You often don't need flash to get a great picture and with the flash off you'll save battery charge. You can certainly preview your pictures to get the best results. Need to get that quick picture with no time to set the adjustments? Just hit the AUTO button!Strengths:Very small and compact, fits in shirt pocket when turned off.Excellent image quality with very adequate zoom range.Large easy to see LCD screen.Easy to use AUTO-mode with plenty of pre-defined creative modes.Rechargeable Lithium Ion battery.Camera can be set for personal preferences, like sound volume and LCD brightness.Rapid downloading of pictures to your computer.Weaknesses:No optical view finder.Controls are small and a bit cramped.Zoom control is in an awkward position.No case or SD card included.

Reviews.Title: Great features. Image quality is lacking.
Reviews.Author: Leon
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace a PowerShot SD780 IS ELPH that I have had for 3 years. The A4000 has decent reviews on other sites, so I bit. I wish I would have paid more and bought another Canon SD/ELPH.One thing the A4000 only takes 720p video at 25fps. My old SD780 did at 30fps.For my review, I am almost directly comparing the A4000 to my old SD780 which is 3 years old.A4000 Pros:1) Taking video with the steadyshot works very well.2) Miniature effect and other modes are fun3) Takes fast photos4) Zoom is phenomenal. 8x optical + 4x digital.5) View screen is large and sharp6) Construction feels really solidA4000 Cons:1) Video seems choppy and heavily compressed (blocky) compared to the SD7802) 720p is only at 25fps when most other models are 30fps3) Photos don't seem as sharp as the SD7804) Sound recording quality isn't as clear as the SD780

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Tom G
Reviews.Content: The little camera is a charmer. The picture quality is color perfect. Has a big LCD display. The response time of the controls and zoom are very snappy. It has 8x optical zoom and if you keep your finger on the zoom it continues after a slight warning pause onto digital zoom for 32x. Yeah, the pic will get a bit grainy at that level but you've got lots of pixels to work with. What I really like is the light weight and it fits into my shirt pocket. Or, get the Case Logic case and snug it into your pants pocket or a purse. It's so light, you will actually take this one with you and use it. The price is great for the quality and I love the blue color. Yes, the purist will say there are compromises with a super small camera like this but it's not a concern for the average person taking snapshots and the occasional movie. I've had larger Canons but I like this one the best because it's usable and has plenty of features. Macro photography (closeups) is automatic and really easy. Canon did a great job on this camera.

Reviews.Title: Little Camera with Big Features
Reviews.Author: K. Duncan
Reviews.Content: When my pocket Sony camera died, I thought I wanted a little bigger camera with more features, but friends with bigger, "real" cameras convinced me to look for another pocket-sized camera for ease of carrying.  I compared at a lot of cameras in this "class" and am very happy with my decision to go with this Canon PowerShot.First, for such a little camera, it has so many cool features that I've had a hard time remembering they are all available, including many features that before now were only available in photo editing software such as fisheye and monochrome.  I will be honest that it's unlikely that I'll be able to use features like this "on the fly" for quick shots of the kids.  But if you are setting up a nice shot, it's fun to run through these features to see what you can get.  Probably the nicest thing is that even with a whole slew of manual modes available, it has a very nice and effective fully automatic mode which pretty much fixes any shot so it's good.  The automatic mode does create a bit of a lag in the time to take the photo, but the results are worth it.Second, the zoom quality is awesome. It has 8x optical zoom, then up to 30x digital zoom.  While playing with it around my house, I was amazed at the clear, close up shots I was able to get of small items on a dresser 18 feet away and even further shots of items BEHIND ME taken in the mirror of the dresser!The controls are easy use and fairly intuitive.  Getting to some of the features has taken a little getting used to since some of them are layered and I could not remember how to find them again, but after a while it all makes sense.  My old Sony had a touch screen, but I don't miss it at all.  Having actual buttons has been a nice change with being able to feel the buttons as well as see them.  Also, seeing the photos that have been taken is MUCH eaiser than on the touch screen which required moving from photo taking mode to viewing mode, then back to photo taking mode to continue.  THis Canon has a simple button that takes you right to viewing mode and back.  No multiple steps necessary.I've given it 4 stars rather than 5 only because I had a hard time finding features.  The manual could be more complete with regard to exactly how to USE some of these cool features and how to get to them, rather than just listing that they are there.Over all, I've been very happy with this camera and would recommend it whole heartedly.

Reviews.Title: Takes good pics but NO optical zoom in movie mode
Reviews.Author: guy
Reviews.Content: Good solid camera, high quality built and looks, nice LCD screen and easy user-friendly functions.  Takes good pics and records HD movies.....only one problem, HD movie mode DOES NOT HAVE Optical Zoom.  Which means, if you do zoom (digital zoom) while making HD movies, it'll start blurring.  So that's the only big downside, other than than...it's a great camera, just not a good camcorder.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: 3ddraft
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera actually for work so that we would have a camera to keep in the job truck.  The boss used it first time out and he's not one to pick up technology easily so when he had no complaints on the camera, I knew it was a good buy.  The pictures turned out great even in the shade under the roof.  There is some noticeable camera shake in shady pictures but nothing that couldn't be overcome with some more use and practice.The only major thing I have against this is that in pictures lit by full sun, there is noticeable vignetting.  I notice it since my other camera is a DSLR but for the typical user of this camera, it's not a big deal.  Just be sure to leave some space around your subject so that it doesn't detract when you're processing the pictures.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful, until it wasn't
Reviews.Author: Second Wind
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this camera, it was exactly what I expected, exactly as advertised and I have taken well over 1000 photos with it.  Of a sudden, for no apparent reason, it developed a fine line that runs vertically through every image, dividing the image exactly in half.  This is clearly not a lens scratch or other bump or drop type of damage, this is some electronic gremlin that decided to pay a visit and won't go away.Unfortunately, my return window is closed and I am sending it off to Canon today in the hopes of getting the camera back functioning as it was 3 months ago.Keep you posted.Update:  Contacted Canon and within a week I had a replacement.  It was refurbished but looks new to me.  Canon could not have been more accomodating and polite. They did not want the accessories returned and so as an added bonus I now have an extra charger and battery. Add another star to this review.

Reviews.Title: Never met a Canon I didn't like... until now.
Reviews.Author: CTN "frosty"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last night.  I'll be returning it tonight or tomorrow.  The picture quality is great and the zoom worked very well. The buttons were slightly hard to use because they were so small, but that's not a major issue for me.My first concern was the ridges on the cover for the lens.  My current powershot is smooth and I carry it in my purse everywhere.  (I have an 8mp camera on my phone but they have nothing on a canon!)  I am afraid to carry this one in my purse because the ridges will catch and open and possibly scratch my lens.My second concern, the main reason I'm returning it, is because it takes so long to take a picture.  I have two kids, 6 & 7, and they don't want to wait 5 seconds while the camera "thinks" about it!  It took considerably longer to take multiple shots, also.  My current p&s; is a SD1100IS Elph.  I've carried it around in my purse and my back pocket for a couple years and was planning on passing it on to my mother-in-law when I got this new one.  However, I will keep my 1100 for a while longer until I find something that seems as durable as this one is!If you're using this camera for non-time sensitive shots, I'm sure this is a wonderful camera (I currently have a Rebel T3i, a 5D, the 1100 Elph and my husband has 2 p&s; canons).  I zoomed all the way in and took a photo of an olive oil bottle.  The words were clear, the IS technology worked very well.  It's simply not a camera that will work for what I need.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Judy White
Reviews.Content: Best camera I've owned -- simple to use, Canon quality, lots of features. I like the larger screen with sharper image, as well as the compact size.  Only thing I miss is a viewfinder lens for bright days.

Reviews.Title: Returned this camera shortly after purchase
Reviews.Author: wesotevoli
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed in this camera. I own a Canon DSLR but wanted a smaller, more compact camera to be able to take pictures with. It is capable of taking great pictures but all of the conditions have to be just right. The shutter speed was unbelievably slow. While trying to take a picture of my child playing, by the time the camera actually took the picture they were long out of the shot. If you hold the button down to "force" the camera to take the picture, it was horribly blurred and defeated the purpose of taking the picture in the first place. Even when waiting for the camera to focus, the pictures were not of the quality I have come to expect from Canon.  I tried using different features, settings and everything I could think of but nothing changed the fact that this camera is not worth buying. I knew that it was not capable of operating at the same level as my DSLR but I still expected it to operate at a basic level of "point and shoot" and take good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great size for a "purse camera."
Reviews.Author: M. Schoenfeld
Reviews.Content: I am replacing a c. 2005 Olympus point-and-shoot digital camera. Anything newer would be vastly superior.I was considering the Canon PowerShot G15 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom as a do-it-all camera, but I take a lot of action photos. I need a *fast* camera--a DSLR. So I went all the way up to a Canon EOS Rebel T4i 18.0 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 18-135mm EF-S IS STM Lens, but I am not going to keep that in my purse!Why miss a great shot simply because I don't have my camera with me? This little cutie will always be with me wherever I go.I could hardly wait for the battery to charge! Being familiar with digital cameras, I figured out the interface within minutes. I ran the camera through all its combinations. Fun! An 8x zoom and all the cool auto settings--including "toy camera" and fisheye--are fun to play with.Image stabilization means that I can do hand-held shots in less-than-perfect lighting and get a good image on the first try most of the time. Saves a lot of time when processing images.If you don't plan to read the user manual on CD, you'll be missing out on a lot of great information about the features. IT IS WORTH THE TIME TO LEARN HOW YOUR CAMERA WORKS. Look at the CD. More than once. Until you learn what all the controls do.The battery charger is small -- no cord! :-) The prongs flip out and then back in again. The charger lies flat against the wall when it is in use. There is an indentation so you can use the second electrical socket at the same time.The automatic lens cover is very delicate. Do not quickly lay the camera lens-side down as it is still closing. I got something caught in there, but the camera seemed OK after I opened and closed it a few times to check.I am very pleased with this choice for a "purse camera." When I need a better image, or ability to shoot rapid fire, I'll have the "big girl" DSLR.When I use the cable to connect the A4000IS to my Win 7 PC, I get the option of deleting the images off the camera right after they're downloaded to the PC. Saves me a step later. You can also mark certain images as "protected," so that they will not be deleted except when you format the camera's memory card. Maybe take a photo of your contact information, and protect that?The cable also works with my Canon Rebel, so right after I empty one camera, I stick the cable into the other and download off that one as well.UPDATE - JUNE 2, 2013: Within two months, this camera started to lose its ability to focus on something close in bright sunlight. It progressively got worse. The lens cannot focus and the shutter does not fire. The shutter will fire for long-range subjects, but the image is blurry. I did some online research. I'm not the only one who has experienced this.I CAN SEE DUST BEHIND THE FRONT LENS ELEMENT when I go out into natural sunlight and move the camera back and forth to give me some 3D perspective.I contacted Canon via e-mail. The recommended solution is to send in the camera for cleaning. Will this be a permanent fix? Am I better off just returning this camera, and starting all over? I'll be back for an update.UPDATE - JULY 5, 2013: I sent the camera to Canon. As soon as it arrived at their repair shop, they sent me a message by e-mail. Within 24 hours, they wrote back again to tell me that the camera could not be repaired for lack of parts. Really? It's relatively new. They sent me a reconditioned replacement. By FedEx. Faster than I was expecting. So I'm back in business, with only about a week of downtime. I'll watch this new camera for the same problem, but I'm happy to have my little purse camera back again!I appreciated Canon's fast response and their willingness to do what it takes to make me love this camera again. Canon sent a follow-up e-mail to ask how I liked their repair service. I think they are trying hard to make their customers happy.UPDATE - NOVEMBER 20, 2013: I am now on the THIRD camera. And I think that the auto focus is starting to go. Again. I assume that if the problem is a one-time fix, the reconditioned cameras that Canon has been sending me should stay fixed. But they haven't. I probably have time to return it two more times for replacements before the warranty is up. But will I bother? What's the point? I need a purse camera that will last for more than the one-year warranty period. So I have to downgrade my rating from 4 stars to ... two? One? Maybe one is all I can rate this camera. Pitiful. I wanted so badly to love it.UPDATE - JANUARY 14, 2014: I am approaching the end of the one-year warranty. I will return the camera one last time for a replacement. But I will not be able to let it rattle around loose in my purse. The dust eventually kills it. A local Canon dealer recommended I go with a sealed-lens camera such as the Canon D20. I'm not all that excited about giving up some of the image clarity for the durability. So I'm really on the fence. And the tops of the fence slats are poking me in the butt. I guess I'll keep the A4000 in my purse, but also put it inside a camera case to reduce the amount of dust it encounters while it's in there waiting for me to whip it out for a quick snapshot.I LOVE THIS CAMERA! It feels so wonderful in my hand. It takes decent photos for a camera of its size. I only wish it didn't succumb so easily to dust in the lens.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: Yasmeen
Reviews.Content: The only reason I'm rating this camera 4 stars is because I don't really like the design of it. HOWEVER, this camera is REALLY good. Especially for the price! The pink color is a very nice salmon color too, I would recommend that one. It has a lot of nice features and special effects. One of my favorite effects is the black & white. Not many cameras have that! Which I thought was awesome. It also has a whole bunch of other nice effects already in the camera, which is pretty cool so you don't have to transfer them then edit them on your laptop.Overall this is a very nice camera. AND it's super cheap! If you're thinking of buying a nice everyday point & shoot that takes clear photos for a low price, this is a good choice. :)

Reviews.Title: Nice camera with ease of use with good picture quality and Zoom
Reviews.Author: Abhi
Reviews.Content: I had a Sony DSC H9 and was looking for something small and easy to carry, but at the same time did not wanted to compromise on the quality of pictures. This camera works good in sunlight and the pictures are really awesome. During night or indoors with less light the camera focuses on the subject in the Auto mode and the background is completely black. this was something I didnt like about this camera, but apart from this a very nice camera with good picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures, but not for the elderly
Reviews.Author: Craig R Layne
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with intentions of giving it to my 70 year old grandmother. I unboxed the camera to try it out first and was EXTREMELY pleased with the pictures it took. They were very clear, and exactly what I expected from a camera in this price range.However, the one thing I hadn't considered (even during my testing) was that my grandmother has rather weak fingers. Upon presenting the camera to her I noticed that she had a lot of trouble pressing the shutter button. She was able to do it, but it took some effort.I've decided to keep the camera (I like it that much) but I will be looking for one with slightly less resistance in the shutter button.

Reviews.Title: Happy with camera
Reviews.Author: tieman
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace another small canon camera (PowerShot SD1100 IS) that died from the dreaded lens error problem. It works pretty much the same as my earlier camera and that is one of the reasons for choosing this one. I miss the view finder but the lcd screen seems to be brighter than the previous camera. After using it for a couple weeks I have to say I am very satisfied with it and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: canon rep
Reviews.Content: This is a really low price for such a great product.  This camera is awesome i paid $180 for it wish i would've known about this deal.... Well the camera is well worth every penny and yours comes with a 8GB SD card mine didn't come with anything.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: M. Savini
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews but felt compelled after reading Sarahs giving it a 1 star review after it stopped working because she broke it.  Its a good camera for the money.  There are some limitations as detailed in other reviews but are easy to look past given. The price.

Reviews.Title: canon camera
Reviews.Author: Joanne Winrow
Reviews.Content: lens keeps jamming and is unable to reset itself!! it is a nice camera lots of issues with the zoom. do not recommend this model . I have another canon that does not have these issues!

Reviews.Title: BAD
Reviews.Author: Jessie Biggins
Reviews.Content: the lens would not close. called customer service at Canon. Had to send it in. Next day get an email " they do not repair this camera".  Why did I waste my money to send it in? Located my receipt and it is still in warranty but now i am told I have to SNAIL MIAL THE RECEIPT; they do not accept email to see if they WILL warranty it. It has a 1 year warranty. DO NOT BUY CANONHORRID CUSTOMER SERVICE!

Reviews.Title: Canon does it again :
Reviews.Author: Larry  P. Whitfill
Reviews.Content: Worth every cent it cost!!!!  For its size it does a good job-no need to carry larger camera to capture the monment----

Reviews.Title: Canon A400IS Great, Easy Camera
Reviews.Author: wcpbkeyes
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived early!! and in pristine condition. It has a beautiful display, takes great pictures in a wide range of conditions and is very easy and intuitive to use. The cycle time between photos is very acceptable. All in all a good purchase at a great price.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Colibri
Reviews.Content: This camera was to replace an old Elph, but instead it's my backup camera. The camera has problems focusing. I take a lot of pictures, and 99% are not crisp and in focus--especially faces. Colors are dull and washed out, and sometimes the color balance is off. The video part works when the subject is not moving and the sound quality is fine.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Anh A. Nguyen-huu "FifiEwok"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera and received it on March 29, 2013. Four days later, on April 2, 2013 we took it with us on our overseas trip. Four days into our trip, the camera's focusing mechanism stopped working and the telescopic lens made cracking noise when powered on or off. Not being able to use it, we put it away in a corner of our cabin. Luckily, we had an old Sony CyberShot with us and we managed to record all the events of our voyage.We were in the Indian Ocean at that time and the satellite reception was down to zero, hence could not call Canon to report the troubles. When we got back to the US on April 22, 2013, we immediately contacted Canon Sales Office for an exchange or refund. Were however told that we had exceeded the grace period of 14 days by 9 days and nothing could be done except to send the camera to the Service Department for repair. Once they received the unit, it was immediately confirmed that repair could not be done on it. So they sent us a refurbished one.We bought a new camera, had it in our possession just for less than 8 days but now got a refurbished one instead. Is it fair?The colors of the pictures, when the camera worked, were very good and it is easy to use. But the quality was completely missing and the manufacturer did not live up to its reputation or its commitments.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: David A. Castellano
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a few Canon camera's in the past and have been very happy. This lens on this model broke during our vacation in Italy after 3 months, we called Canon and it was out of warranty. The lens is stucked can't be fixed after only using it a few times of careful use. I feel like Canon did nothing to help and wasted my money on a poorly built product. This will be the last Canon camera I purchase.

Reviews.Title: Takes awful pictures
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: I buy cameras that are less than $150 because with 2 toddlers they always get dropped or destroyed somehow. This is by far the worst one I have had (3 in the last 3 years). The picture quality is awful. The colors are off. A lot of pictures come out blurry. I am hoping one of my kids will drop it in a large pool of water so that it can forever be gone from my life. Okay, that's a little dramatic...but it's so useless that I just end up taking photos on my iphone. It's so much better.

Reviews.Title: I returned it
Reviews.Author: dean
Reviews.Content: The  lens stop working in the middle of vacation luckily I took two cameras with us. Or it would have been terrible

Reviews.Title: Hate this camera
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when my beloved digital ELPH came down with the fatal lens error. This camera is the one that came up as the newest version of that ELPH. There is no comparison between the two cameras. This version doesn't have a "kids and pets" setting, so it's darn near impossible to get a decent action shot. A while back I discovered I couldn't get the flash to fire, even when you attempt to "force" it. It just doesn't flash anymore. Even in decent light conditions indoors, the shots come out extremely dark. I can't believe how much I dislike this camera. I get better pictures with my phone.

Reviews.Title: Impressed with Cannon!
Reviews.Author: purchaser
Reviews.Content: Sooo this little camera was great...for about 6 month and then out of no where it was giving me screen error and then would shut off automatically.  Yes I was annoyed.  We were in the middle of a 2 week road trip when this happened...so no documentation of the trips second half.  Anyway, I called Cannon and they told me to send it back for a repair/replacement.  I could not have been more impressed with Cannon's customer service, the guy I spoke with was great, and the processing was very speedy.  I sent the camera to them on a Thursday and had a brand new camera at my house the following tuesday.  All in all best service experience I've received ever and the new camera works great.

Reviews.Title: For the most part, I love it.
Reviews.Author: Hang Marquez
Reviews.Content: It's a great little camera.  I love that it has a "Program" mode so I can customize the shooting settings to my liking.  In order to take full advantage of this camera (or any camera), YOU HAVE TO REALLY READ THE MANUAL!!!  I scanned through the manual when I first bought this camera and only shoot with "Auto".  Those pictures look good but not great.  After I read through the manual and set my "Program" mode.  Those pictures look so much better.  I gave this camera 4/5 stars because I feel the the focus are not focusing well.  Every time I took picture of human, their faces don't look focus (not blurry, just not as clear as I want it to be), but inanimate objects came out super clear.  So, there you go.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera
Reviews.Author: Deena T.
Reviews.Content: Why isn't zero stars an option?  I hate this camera, it takes beautiful pictures, but it takes forever to get it to take the picture, then recharge the flash, and take the next picture.  I have a 7 month old son and by the time it takes the picture he's out of the frame and onto something else.  You literally have to hold the button down for 10 seconds, than it takes the picture, 20-30 seconds later the flash is ready for the next pic.  I've lost out on too many amazing photo moments because of this stupid camera.I had a previous Canon PowerShot, a model they don't make any long, this is the next version.  It too took forever to take a photo, but at the time I didn't have a child that I was trying to capture precious moments of.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Luis Gonzalez "luisgonzalez"
Reviews.Content: After some reading people roeviews II decided to buy this camera that was ok for my budget. I've always used Canon cameras and I'm not disappointed with this model so far. I received the camera just in time for a family trip to Disney World in Florida and i got good pictures with daylight, and decent pictures with night light. Response time to save is slow sometimes, not sure if this is because of the SD memory card or the camera itself, sometimes it's frustrating if you want to take more than one quick pictures. Options menu is hard to navigate sometimes if you want to change picture settings.In general I recommend this point and shot camera for casual photography  you'll get a good product for the money.

Reviews.Title: What Happened???
Reviews.Author: Renee Taylor
Reviews.Content: We bought this cameral and a large memory card to take with us on a cruise. At first, it seemed to work great, except for 4-5 second delays in between pics.  We have a larger Nikon, but we needed a smaller camera to take on excursions. On our second excursion day, the battery started to die, and then the camera did a weird sonic-type flash and shut down. After charging up the battery later on the ship, the camera opened, but the screen was black. The message received was, "no images available." This was the first cruise for our teenagers, so we were just sick that we possbily lost 300+ pictures from a day we could not replicate because we were hundreds of miles out to sea by then. Only after we returned home and opened the memory card in a different format on our laptop did we find that we hadn't lost the pics, BUT, the camera is shot. It was not dropped in water or onto any other surface. It just died. We'll be returning this camera for either a replacement or a full refund!

Reviews.Title: Hope my experience is an exception..
Reviews.Author: karthik chandran
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for my daughter based on reviews I saw of the product on Amazon. She must have used the camera on 3 occasions and then gave it back to me saying it did not work. The battery would not recharge and we were prompted to replace the battery pack. I spent additional $$ replacing the battery pack. Now the shutter does not close and I am being told the battery pack is bad and I need to get another one. I am now tossing this one as $$ poorly spent and am looking for a better camera.

Reviews.Title: No good
Reviews.Author: Ms.Healthnut
Reviews.Content: I thought Canon is a reputable brand! However this is just a cheap one. I am returning it because all the pictures I have taken are blurry and the color of the pictures are so pale. My daughter has a Canon elph 100hs and it's awesome take really great pictures and the colors are vibrant. I am so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Can't open battery door
Reviews.Author: Stuart
Reviews.Content: The battery door was extremely hard to open and since you need to remove the battery every time to recharge, this was an awefule design.  Not sure if it was meant to be more water tight or a design defect but bad product.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed; flash stopped working
Reviews.Author: Glenn Richter
Reviews.Content: I had good expectations when I bought the Canon A4000 six months ago.  There were nice features, such as an 8X optical zoom, and a small size, for a decent price.  I've shot perhaps 300 images since purchase, a number of them with flash.  And now -- on a vacation abroad -- the flash stopped working, ruining several important shots and preventing me from taking others.  No, my camera wasn't knocked around or misused.  The battery is charged.  I had a family member who's quite conversant with Canon digital cameras try to troubleshoot as well. No luck.  I'm deeply disappointed with Canon's product failure, just as I wanted to enjoy my camera the most.  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Author: frankenstein
Reviews.Content: We bought these cameras for warehouse employees, however they only last a month or less because any slight knock while the lens is out and it damages the flawed zoom mechanism.Once the lens error happens the camera is worthless.Avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: Lens is stuck and wont open after 9 months
Reviews.Author: RA "RA"
Reviews.Content: I have been pleased with this camera--good pictures, easy to use--but it has broken after 9 months of use. The lens is stuck in the "closed" position, so when you turn on the camera, it tries to open the lens and then says "error" and shuts down.We haven't dropped it or anything. I have put it in my purse and maybe it got jostled, but you would expect it to tolerate that.

Reviews.Title: This camera had Error 32 message from the start
Reviews.Author: gary c gibson
Reviews.Content: Error 32 messages are common. They mean something is wrong with the camera's lens housing I believe. It turns off the camera automatically after about 60 seconds. So one can take 3 or 4 quick photos or a brief video and then it shuts down.There was something wrong with the lens protection system when the camera is off from the start. There is a little piece or two that I believe is supposed to open on starting and close when going off.When the camera's lens extension and closing motor starting making noises I took off the lens cover to look at it and that's as far as one can go at making a repair. I took out the one non-functioning lens protection arm-the other was missing.If one has a notebook computer the software with the camera may not install. Photos downloaded directly to the web book from the camera are in quicktime mode-not too useful for a pc.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: Art-KR
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera this spring. I wanted a small camera with wide angle lens and it was discounted at Office depot. I already had the Canon Digital Elph 780 and really liked it. Anyway I used the camera a few times and then it would not sync with the computer any more. Emailed Canon and ended up sending it in. I was annoyed because I had to pay for shipping, having just bought the camera, but they sent me back a refurbished one, quickly. I was also annoyed that it was a refurbished one, but it looked brand new and it works.I took both my cameras out west with me on a trip. I was disappointed in the macro setting. I took pictures of flowers with it and they were blurry. They actually turned out clearer on the auto setting. I took some landscape pictures of mountains that turned out beautiful and had high quality of detail and beautiful color. I think the wide angle works and helps the landscape pictures turn out better. I'm just an very! amateur photographer so I still have a lot to learn. I've noticed that most interior pictures do not require the flash so most of the time I keep it turned off.The A4000IS is heavier and a little bit thicker than the 780 Elph but it still is very portable. I like the rounded corners.One thing I was very disappointed about was that Canon has discontinued including a Manual with it. The manual is on the computer disc. With the 780 Elph I carried my little manual around with me in the case and it was very helpful. Having to look on the computer every time I want to know how to do something is unhandy and impractical on the road.I really don't care for the software and as far as I can tell you have to use it to upload your pictures. My 780 Elph does not require that. I like to use Photoshop Elements to edit my photos so I don't like the extra steps. After downloading the pictures they go to files in the Pictures Section of the Libraries on Windows 8 so I exit the Canon Browser and go straight to Photoshop for editing.Both cameras take regular size SD cards for memory and their batteries come with the camera and are rechargeable and come with a charger that plugs in a wall socket so these features make them a lot cheaper to use.All in all I like the camera okay but I think there are other ones out there in the same price range I might have liked better.

Reviews.Title: Shutter problem
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: Although this may be a one-off issue, thought I should mention it. For the one I got, the shutter does not close properly. When you press "off", you can tell it tries to close but is stuck. You have to manually push it back in.Also a minor issue. The battery cabin is very difficult to open. You have to press and slip very hard to open it. When I showed to my father, he cannot even open it.Again, not sure if this is a one-off thing. Just want to let you know what I got.It was supposed to be a gift for my father who is in another country. So this is very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: good amateur camera
Reviews.Author: Carrie Befort
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for someone who just wants pictures for memories or fun. The main problem is that if it is on auto it can take a few seconds to determine circumstances so it takes longer to take a picture. After, however, it determines circumstances, if you take another picture in the same place it is much faster. The quality of video for a  hand held camera is excellent and the pictures are good as well. For my uses, it is perfect.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA FOR US SNAPSHOT TAKERS
Reviews.Author: WRR "mailcat8"
Reviews.Content: Works perfectly.  For a case that is a good fit (not too tight) and has a small compartment that can hold an extra battery, try Caselogic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage that I got w/ this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised
Reviews.Author: Quiet D
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much and already have a big fancy SLR with different lenses, etc., but I ordered the PowerShot to throw in my purse on vacation and ended up using it almost the entire time.  It takes great pictures without being bulky, is easy to use and the zoom feature is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Company
Reviews.Author: KerouacBean
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend bought me this camera in March and it worked great. It's easy to use, the color is so pretty (I got blue), and it's so easy to upload the pictures to my computer. Plus the program that comes with the camera automatically sorts the pictures in my folder into separate folders by date which is so convenient and makes the photos easy to sift through and find. A few months after having the camera, I pulled it out of the case and every picture had a line across the image, even when I uploaded the pictures to my computer. I emailed Canon and they told me to send it in. I had to pay for shipping to get it to Canon, but once I sent it in, Canon had returned to me a refurbished camera in less than a week with a brand new battery and charger, all the accessories, so now I have two of each of those. The camera works great and I didn't have to pay a cent for the repair because I believe it was soon enough after I bought it. I had ended up sending it in almost six months after purchasing it. I am very pleased with Canon's service. They emailed me back in a timely fashion with all the details I needed and then my camera was returned to me completely fixed so quickly and with new accessories. I don't usually write product reviews, but I wanted to give Canon the shout out they deserved for this. I will have no problem buying a Canon again.

Reviews.Title: You can't go wrong for the price..
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I was looking for something to replace my old Fuji 3800 FinePix which has 3 megapixels and 6X optical zoom.  The Fuji actually takes very sharp pictures (primary reason is its low, non-adjustable ISO setting of 100), but it's a bit bulky.  I wanted something compact that I could put in my shirt pocket and didn't cost much, yet had reasonable zoom and took pics at least equal to the Fuji's quality.  I think I found it in the Canon A4000.I've used it only for about a week, but I'm very pleased.  First off, forget about using it in Auto mode because it decides on the ISO setting (what used to be called the ASA number with film).  The higher the ISO, the grainier and less sharp the picture.  For general picture taking you want to set the ISO at the lowest setting (for this camera, 100).  You do that by selecting the P mode (Programmed Auto Exposure).  Photos in Auto mode will be less sharp if the camera automatically sets the ISO higher than 100.  Even though you can't set ISO in Auto mode, you know what the camera is selecting by pressing and holding the shutter button half-way and you see it indicated in the lower right corner of the screen.  Very often, despite what appears to be a well-lit situation, in Auto mode the photo is taken at an ISO higher than 100 which explains a less sharp image than if it were taken in P mode at ISO 100.  Of course, in lower light situations you want to select higher ISOs in order to get proper exposure even though the result won't be as sharp.  A disadvantage for selecting the lowest ISO in P mode is that the shutter speed will often be slower than in Auto mode which risks image blur.  But that should be compensated by the automatic image stabilization feature.Interestingly enough, even though the camera has 16 megapixels its image quality at ISO 100 is no better then my old Fuji with 3 megapixels.  So, I can't say I'm not satisfied although you'd expect that with more than 5 times the pixel resolution, the photos with the A4000 would be somewhat crisper than the old Fuji.... which tells me that the number of megapixels being touted is overblown -- I'm sure a lot depends on the camera's image processor (CMOS vs. CCD) and its other technical characteristics.  At any rate, for a little over a hundred bucks I have no complaints and the photos are good to excellent in sharpness and outstanding in color rendition...plus it fits neatly and lightly in my shirt pocket.  I recommend it.Incidentally, the Canon Image Browser EX software that comes with the camera is OK, for a freebie.  It's not Adobe Photoshop by any means and has some nice features such as image sharpening, but it's ease of use is only fair.

Reviews.Title: lens error after 3 months
Reviews.Author: toto "toto"
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with this product. the lens cannot shut down after I used it for 3 months, I have to push them back manually every time. Now, after 4 months, the lens cannot come out!

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I'm a camera buff and semi-pro photographer.  I've been in galleries and all that.  Fine art.  I've had over 40 digital cameras, as well a a bunch of film ones.  This is my go-everywhere camera, believe it or not.  Small, fairly light, and takes great pictures AND video!  Bring the pics into Photoshop and with a couple clicks you end up with REALLY stunning shots.  But even straight out of the camera I'm amazed.  Especially for the money.  Now, if you want to drop some serious money, the best bigger, but not as big as a DSLR, digital camera out right now is the Olympus OM-D E-M1.  Mind-blowing.  But $1,400.

Reviews.Title: This was  a replacement for a camera that I dropped - quick & easy to use
Reviews.Author: Carlotta Christensen
Reviews.Content: I had a camera just like this before, but I dropped it.  This camera takes good pictures for a small, inexpensive camera.  I really like that I can carry it in my purse or pocket.  It is quick & easy to use!  I've happy with my purchase!  :)  This time I bought the 2 yr. insurance for approx. $10, in case I drop my new camera.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Laura Motoyoshi
Reviews.Content: Needed an easy to use with good quality camera.  This fit my requirements. A very good buy for someone who is technically challenged.

Reviews.Title: Lens error rendered the camera worthless just out of warranty
Reviews.Author: TSMayberry
Reviews.Content: I loved the camera for the year that it worked.  I usually took it with me to work functions off site when I didn't want to be bothered hauling around my Nikon digital SLR. Loved the video feature, even indoors.I was plagued by the automatic lens cap that would not close properly.  Then the camera zoom lens stopped working completely, When I try to turn the camera on the screens says "Lens error Will shut down automatically  Restart camera." The problem is that when I restart the camera I get the same message, and of course it powers off completely.

Reviews.Title: It only lasted a year
Reviews.Author: Mazz
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for Christmas 2012.  1 year and 1 month later the lens would not close and the digital screen read "lens error, restart camera"  after several attempts  turning the camera on and off the lens would not retract and the camera wouldn't allow me to take any pictures.  I sent it to Canon repair and they replied  that the camera is non repairable, but for $89 they would send me a refurbished one.  I cannot believe that after only 1 year the camera is no longer operable.  This speaks poorly for Canon products.  I was in the market for a high end 35mm SLR and no way will I buy a Canon now, I'm going with Nikon.  If they can't get a basic point and shoot right I'm not taking a chance with another Canon product.  UPDATE**  Called Canon today and they are replacing my camera for free. I was very surprised so I have to reconsider them due to their excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: not bad.. but fairly slow.
Reviews.Author: Hoang Tran
Reviews.Content: I got this for my parents since the buttons and screen were bigger than most small digital cameras. I thought it would be easy for them, turn on, point, auto focus, shoot. That wasn't the case. The build quality is a bit disappointing.. but given the price, i should've lowered my expectations. When turning the camera on, it is fairly slow...almost "cell phone camera" slow. I set everything on automatic so my parents just need to turn it on and shoot. However, the shots come out fairly blurry. I attribute this to being my parents fault as they don't really understand how to hold half down to focus then full press to get the shot. But also I had issues getting clear shots. I messed around with some settings and was finally able to get clearer images. But when i transferred them to my pc, the image quality was not on par with my canon elph 150.

Reviews.Title: Image Quality and Shutter Speed is lacking
Reviews.Author: T. Weber
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for a year now.  While I have been very impressed with the image quality in full sun, the image quality in low-light settings is not very good.  The images are often grainy, or the camera does not focus well and images do not have sharp clear edges.  We have children, and have been very disappointed in the images we take of them.  Though kids do move a lot, our previous canon took great pictures even though the time between pictures lagged.  We find that this camera lags between each picture, and that the images are often blurry.  I do not recommend this camera unless you plan to take all pictures outside and in full sun.

Reviews.Title: Poor quality
Reviews.Author: DAnie118
Reviews.Content: The quality is inconsistent-I should have returned it.  In the beginning I thought I just needed to become more familiar with the camera but the quality never improved.  I have friends with the same camera and whenever they looked at my camera they weren't sure why mine didn't work.

Reviews.Title: Little workhorse
Reviews.Author: R. Arnold
Reviews.Content: This little baby really delivers.  Has more features than I'll ever use and the AUTO mode gets some great shots for a change.LCD display could be brighter:  Hard to see sometimes under bright sunlight.  Have dropped it, got it wet, basically beat it up in my jersey pocket on bike rides and it just takes a lickin' and keeps on tickin'.  Does GREAT HD video too.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with Image Quality :-(
Reviews.Author: ivang3 "ivan"
Reviews.Content: I'm always picky about image quality.  This camera is nice and small, but I'm disappointed with it's image quality so I'm now selling and trying to get some money back.  I had to revive colors quite a bit with Photoshop.  Also, the images were not very sharp.  I would go to dpreview.com and find some better cameras for slightly more $.  It would be worth it.  I originally paid $120 at the beginning of the year.

Reviews.Title: Nothing special, but solid nonetheless
Reviews.Author: Andy A
Reviews.Content: This is an asbolutely nothing special but very solid point and shoot camera. The power on time is excellent but the time between shots can take several seconds- not great for fast moving objects/animals/people. Quality is great in the daytime, but nighttime or low light shots suffer without a stabilizer like a tripod- noise and blurriness creep on fast as light diminishes.Overall this a great camera for families taking well lit pictures at parties, and decent as a vacation camera. If you want fast picture-to-picture time or better low light performance, you will most likely have to spend more than you will spend on this camera.+ fast power on+ decent battery+ can record HD video- suffers in low light (blurry, noise)- can take a noticeable amount of time to write picture to SD card

Reviews.Title: Low-light photos very grainy
Reviews.Author: M. Edwards "fpmdsc"
Reviews.Content: I had hoped to get away with getting a quality pocket point-and-shoot camera for about $100.  Big mistake.  I have great appreciation for most Canon imaging products, but this one misses the mark (although I don't blame Canon at this price).  With relatively favorable reviews I was hoping for a CCD sensor that had the quality of a CMOS sensor.  But such point-and-shoots apparently don't exist.  Low-light images (e.g. In a museum that does not allow flash photography) were very grainy.  Outdoor images were good but not great.  I very well may return this and look for a Canon point-and-shoot with a CMOS sensor.  That will probably cost at least $100 more than this one.  But when you are taking photos of once-in-a-lifetime experiences, do you really want to take the chance on sub-par image quality of your photos?  I sure don't.

Reviews.Title: The most digital camera you can buy at this price point
Reviews.Author: William Marling
Reviews.Content: I've been an amateur and professional photographer for 50 years.This is my favorite pocket camera. It does not cost a fortune, so if  I lose it -- and you do lose these things -- I am not out a fortune.  This is the third one I have ownedIt takes decent video with sound, and good still shots. It has a good variety of pre-programmed 'modes,' and I particularly like the silent or stealth mode.It is durable. Survives minor falls.  Relatively moisture-proof, unlike the Casio.  Not fazed by very hot or very cold weather.Battery life is excellent, and it can be re-charged on the same charger in Europe or the USA.How can you beat it?

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Janet Pski "Janetpski"
Reviews.Content: This summer I had the awful experience of losing my old Canon PowerShot while on vacation.  I was heart broken because I loved that camera and had taken many wonderful pictures with it.  After a week of researching for a replacement I settled on this one and I have not been disappointed.  It is easy to use and, like my old camera, it takes great pictures without a lot of fuss.  If that is what you are looking for this camera is for you.

Reviews.Title: just so so
Reviews.Author: Kane0409
Reviews.Content: just 8x, i think it should be 16x or 20x. but it's cheap, so i think it's ok. maybe i should pay more money to buy a better one.

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied
Reviews.Author: Ryene
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of reviews before purchasing this camera and they were mostly positive but I wish I would have picked a different camera.  It is a decent simple camera for regular picture taking.  But the zoom is awful.  U get a blurred, unrecognizable picture when you zoom in.  I was looking for a camera that was better than my 6 year old Kodak but honestly,  they seem to be exactly the same.

Reviews.Title: Excellent, attractive camera.
Reviews.Author: jama555us
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is very user friendly, and very solid built. The pictures turn out great and it is very easy to transfer the pictures from camera to computer.The only drawback to the camera is the there is a longer than user lag between pictures and the images on the LCD screen appear grainy.However, the bottom line is that I have taken some of the best pictures ever with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Deborah N.
Reviews.Content: really easy to use  takes  great pictures. Good for on the go people. I have problems taking pictures, however this camera is great  no more problems

Reviews.Title: small and great resolution
Reviews.Author: BZman
Reviews.Content: This small Camera has many great features with incredible zoom for it size. I like the automatic scene select feature. With about $100 you got all you need.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Easy to use camera right out of the box. would recomend to any one looking for an inexpensive camera around the 100 mark.

Reviews.Title: Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: Shar
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality.  My previous Cannon was similar size with a view finder.  Newer small digital cameras don't have view finders.  I missed the view finder feature originally but I'm adjusting.  Video quality is excellent for such a small camera.  Owned this for 2 months,  easy to slip in a pocket or purse - ready for that quick shot!  Several features I have yet to use but should enjoy.

Reviews.Title: As always: Perfect.
Reviews.Author: Jim Transue
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace a ELPH that lasted for 6 years and captured many memories on my motorcycle at many monuments and parks. This did not let me down. It's pictures are crisp and the video sharp. No more others for me.

Reviews.Title: Great quality
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I bought this for someone who is far from being a pro with a camera. The pictures she has taken so far are of great quality, and the camera is simple to use. She likes it very much, and so do I.

Reviews.Title: one great little camera
Reviews.Author: David Hanthorn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to take along on our latest trip to Thailand.  We both ended up using it a lot, cause it is just so darn handy, and it takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon never disappoints!
Reviews.Author: Gail M. Clifford
Reviews.Content: We live in Montana and never leave the house without a camera!  We might miss a herd of elk that needs a zoom lens or a sunset that needs to be shared.  This camera fits in my shirt pocket and it there when I need it.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Tennille M. Anderson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use,so user friendly my 5 year old has no problems navugating the buttons.takes good pictures.Very happy with my purchaseCameras isn't really pink, looks more metallic.

Reviews.Title: Good, little camera
Reviews.Author: Big Wally
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife. I have had 2 other pocket-sized Canons and have been very happy with them. This is a good, little overall camera for family pics, vacation and email. Nothing fancy but just enough to keep most anyone satisfied for casual use.  I bought the camera, case and 16GB memory card as a bundle for around $115. Good value.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A4000 - a very nice camera
Reviews.Author: Pat Whitcomb
Reviews.Content: I like a point and shoot camera and this one fits the bill nicely. It is very compact to take along in my purse and very easy to use. I like the one door that holds both the SD card and the battery. I also like the compact convience of the battery charger. It is very easy to take the wall charger with me when I travel. I have used this camera for 4 months.The door is stronger than the SD door on my Nikon Coolpix that broke.

Reviews.Title: Good, but...
Reviews.Author: RB
Reviews.Content: The Pro's:1) Easy to use, right out of the box.  Literally unpacked it (battery was mostly charged) and ran out the door with no manual to do an outdoor photo shoot.  Not bad for user-friendliness, however...Maybe too much function and options were sacrificed to bring the simplicity that makes it user-friendly...Only two complaints:1) Sorry, I like a viewfinder for bright sunny days when screens are difficult to see.  I don't care what direction technology trends have taken- if they don't work, they need to try something that does.  Even a disposable camera from 20 years ago has a viewfinder!  I gave it a chance, knowing it didn't have one, thinking technology had improved over earlier model, but no - I almost sent it back for this one issue.  Come on - It's a CAMERA - It's primary function is to TAKE PICTURES of what you can SEE.  If you can't see your picture, what's the point?  There aren't any excuses to not feature one.2) Navigation buttons are too small and hard to use.  I don't even have fat fingers, and this is another area I feel has let me down, as my earlier model was just fine in this area. (It was a PowerShot SD890IS)But, the zoom is Great!  I would like to see some fun features/options on my future camera like B&W;, Sepia, or something (at least to make it as good as my OLD Sony)  - It's just lacking a lot of options that make a digital camera desirable over something else that lasts for 20 years.----Bottom line, if you are taking pictures only indoors, this is it.  If you are taking pictures anywhere else, like on a bright sunny day, go for something that is at least as good as a much older model.  Sorry Canon, I liked you, but now you've lost me because no "fun settings" like other point-and-shoot models on the market, no viewfinder like even a disposable camera has (I'm pro-choice in this area), and no adjustable proportions or photo resolution like a camera from 10-years ago.

Reviews.Title: Not that great
Reviews.Author: Nicole "Mommy of Twins"
Reviews.Content: My old Canon camera, a Power Shot SD1100, died after about 5 years so I needed a new camera. I loved my old camera and since it is no longer made, had to look for something else. I obviously wanted something similar, so I came across this one and read the reviews and they seemed pretty good, I assumed it would be comparable to my old camera. Not so. Now I'm not a professional, but I do take a lot of pictures and expect them to be good quality. When I got this camera, I only used it for a few days because it was much cheaper quality than my old camera. It did not seem to have as many options. When I took photos in various situations, the lighting was bad and the flash would either come on when it shouldn't or not come on when it should resulting in very dark or overly bright photos. Also, a vast majority of the photos were blurry, a problem I never had with my old camera. When I loaded the pics onto my computer and saw just how low quality they were I was very disappointed. The colors were not crisp, they were dull and overall it just was cheap. I ended up returning this camera because it wasn't worth the $130 or so that I paid.

Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I have owned Nikons and Panasonic Lumix cameras that have been so simple to use.  This camera has been nothing but frustration.  The biggest issue is that the camera often does not take the picture even though it appears that it did.  Secondly the flash often refuses to go off also resulting in no picture being taken.  I have missed so many pictures.  This camera is also very slow but that is not all that surprising given the price.  Making changes to settings is anything but user intuitive as other reviews have stated.  Our Nikon Coolpix and Panasonic Lumix did not require going to the manual for every little change that one wants or needs to make.  I cannot comment on image quality because we have not been able to take enough pictures to assess it.  Unfortunately we are now just a few days out of the return window so cannot return it otherwise I would.  This is our fist experience with Canon and it has been very bad.  I do not recommend this camera for anyone.

Reviews.Title: great pics

Reviews.Title: PowerShot A400IS

Reviews.Title: Great camera for price

Reviews.Title: Might be defective - not sure yet
Reviews.Author: Jodi Walkonen
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera specifically because I was going hiking and didn't want to carry my pro camera up a mountain. Reviews.Title: Great Compact Camera

Reviews.Title: Good picture for the price
Reviews.Author: Connie
Reviews.Content: The camera takes good pictures and videos. It is probably better to leave it on Auto. I had a a Nikon Coolpix S4300 which cost a little more.(I left it on the roof of my car and found it in the street) So I bought a Canon. The Nikon menu is a lot easier though than the Canon, it has more Scenic choices. Bought the Canon at Best Buy total $106. with tax. No extras a USB and electric battery charger, DVD included. You need to buy a SDHC card. The SanDisk I had with my Nokia fits this camera.Pros-Good pictures and videos. Colors come out just like the scene. Really good zoom. I am still learning how to use it. Light weight, nice blue color.Cons-I just got it but it appears battery has to be removed from camera to be charged. It connects to PC to transfer photos but I don't know if the battery charges like the Nikon does when it attached to the PC. This is a nuisance taking the battery out to recharge. The Nikon battery last longer. The menus are confusing too. When I enlarged a picture and pressed the Set Function to save the picture in the larger form it did not stay larger. I bought an extra battery on Amazon, it was cheap. I hope I will learn how to use this camera better.

Reviews.Author: Andi C Bair
Reviews.Content: Canon A4000 is a fun camera available in many colors. Let me use my usual disclaimer, in the interest of fairness, and admit that I think many cameras by reputable makers (and there are many) deliver what they promise. It is more about what camera traits you are looking for. So, I would suggest to anyone looking to buy one to google 'camera trait search' and get the whole picture.The A4000 is a fixed lens camera (point and shoot, some would say), with 16 resolution (megapixels), and a x8 zoom. The sensor size is 1/2.3 inch CCD-type, which is standard for cameras of its class.If you were to, say, take pictures of friends and family at an outdoor gathering, this camera is what you need. If you get ambitious, there will be stumbling blocks. Here is the camera's trait mix: It does not have a viewfinder, which, again, many in its class don't. The ISO rating, which is the gauge for how well it does in low light, is 1600. That rating is lower than many others, but it is sufficient for most purposes. The video is a Full HD- that is 1980x1080 resolution. It does not have a hot shoe for an external flash option. That is not unexpected for its size and category. The LCD screen is a 230,000 resolution. The camera does not do RAW processing but you would need only if you did not want to be limited by JPEG type storage. It comes with WiFi- very convenient for easy upload. The weight of the camera is a convenient 145 grams.Overall, nice, fun camera. Having been into photography for a while, I do stress though that you do a camera trait search. That will also tell you more about what you want.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Bill A. Belt
Reviews.Content: My Sony  DSC-W150 encountered an issue as the slot holding the memory card apparently lost a  pin or clip as the card would not longer stay in the camera. Everything else worked great. I shopped around and based upon lots of reviews opted for the Canon PowerShot A4000 as being the closest comparable.There are some features on the A4000 that are better than the Sony. The Canon has 16 megapixels while the Sony 8.1 megapixels. The Sony has a 5 X zoom while the Canon has 8 X zoom. I will keep the rest of the review to the Canon.The body of the Canon is aluminum, however the  door holding the memory card and the battery appears to be plastic which at times does not always open or close that freely. The metal tri pod bush is metal and that is good. The screen is a large 3 inch LCD and thus far has worked great both inside and outside. There is no viewfinder and this seems to be common on today’s lower priced point and shoot cameras. The camera comes in four different colors thus get the one that suits you. Mine is red. There is 720p HD for movie shooting and the quality on just the one I have taken is good.The off/on button is on the top of the camera and if you have big fingers you may find at  times the button is a little hard to turn on and off. It is rectangular and less than ½ inch long and imbedded directly into the case at almost case level. Canon advises this button is sunken into the body to prevent accidental depressing when you’re trying to take a picture. The telephoto feature is triggered by the rotating button that surrounds the shutter button. It works fine.The back of the camera is dominated by the 3 inch screen which is not all that bad. The buttons for changes is located on the right and consist of five buttons plus the center ring which has control over four functions. One of the buttons is the top one which is dedicated to the video which I found was easy to operate.The shutter button seems to have a small delay, thus after pushing the button it takes a moment for the shutter to click. I am getting used to it. After power up the shutter button takes a little over two seconds for it to be activated. The memory card is an SD card which is good as it is common and readily obtainable even when traveling.I guess the last question is does it take pictures? I find the quality very acceptable for a point and shoot camera. I use this camera primarily for taking quick photos while traveling and in places that a large digital camera might not be acceptable. Food review pictures are easy to take and after three of four, just drop the small camera in your pocket and this disturbs no one. I have not attempted to make any enlargements for printing as I use a large digital camera for that. This is a nice traveling companion and easily fits into your pocket so you can be ready for that unusual shot.

Reviews.Title: Quality Control & Customer Service Lacking
Reviews.Author: One who devours books "Big Dan"
Reviews.Content: I note that everyone is now lowering their price on this camera...seems it has some issues and I am not the only one having trouble with it.This will likely be the last Canon product I ever deal with in my lifetime.  The camera was given to me as a gift and could not be returned.  It came out of the box defective just like the last one I obtained several years back.  I tried all sorts of things to make it work with no luck.  After some time I finally figured the only way to get it replaced was to send it to Canon directly along with a nice letter explaining how I could not return the item.  It had been a gift from a company (client) and letting the gift giver know it was defective was not an option.  Shortly thereafter I received a proposed repair bill via email for $150.  After several lengthy emails and telephone conversations I still do not have a working camera.  Since I have no specific purchase date and no receipt it would seem I might just be out of luck on this $199 gift.  Yes, you read correctly, $150 to repair a $199 camera which is now valued at $109 here on Amazon.  The best part?  What do I do when I am out on a jobsite with this client and they expect me to use the camera they gave me?  Canon claims to have top notch customer service and quotes endless surveys to prove this is the case.  Apparently they forgot to survey folks like me who think their customer service ranks pretty low.My advice; feel free to buy their products but keep your receipt and note your purchase date so you have a method to return any defective products.  Should you give one of their products as a gift, attached the gift receipt.

Reviews.Content: My review has nothing to do with the camera itself....I've bought other Canon cameras in the past and have relied on their quality over the years and I'm sure this one will be no different.  My disappointment is with the condition of the camera I received.  When I opened the box, it appeared that the camera may have been one that was returned and someone, obviously, didn't check the box when they put it back in stock for resale.  There were items missing; however, the little plastic sleeves were in the box (empty) that I'm sure were supposed to contain those items.  The battery was already installed in the camera, with the battery protector just laying in the box.  When I took the camera out of the sleeve it was in, there was no covering on the screen on the back, to peel off....in fact, the screen appeared scratched and smudged.  I paid for a "new" camera and I was very disappointed to open the box and find, what appeared to be, a restocked item.  Yes, I know that stores put items back on the shelf when they're returned; however, I certainly would have expected a quality check before doing so.  This is my first bad review that I've ever given a product and I feel bad in doing so; however, there needs to be better checks put into practice before sending out an order when someone orders a new product.  I should add that  I don't believe this was the fault of Amazon, but the secondary store that they used to fulfill the order.  I am returning the item and have purchased the same item on Amazon, through a different seller.

Reviews.Title: Very nice features for a very reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Stacy M. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace a Canon Powershot A460 that I had purchased in 2007. I liked my old camera, but was looking for more megapixels and more optical zoom (my old one had 5.0 MP and 4x optical zoom, whereas the A4000IS has 16.0 MP and 8x optical zoom). The A4000IS seems to have all the features I liked about my old camera, plus several new features. The A4000IS has a much bigger screen (3.0"), which is great. My old camera used AA batteries, so I was always able to keep a few rechargeable batteries on hand in my camera case. I was worried that the special battery for the A4000IS (NB-11L) would prevent me from keeping a spare on hand. But, I found a generic battery on eBay for $4 and that seems to work just fine as a spare. The nice thing about these batteries (versus AA batteries) is that they seem to charge very quickly (in 30-60 minutes). I would definitely recommend this camera for anyone who is looking for a very reasonably priced point-and-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Can't handle being outdoors
Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: I have only had this camera a month, dropped it in the dirt on accident, and now the lens is jammed and it is completely unusable. I hate customer service, regardless of the company, so I tried taking it apart myself but broke two belts in it on accident. I spent money on this camera which was desperately needed for other things, so it feels like a complete waste and let down. I am very disappointed that this camera is not as durable as other cameras I have owned in the past and currently own.Update: I dropped the camera while it was OFF in a round pen which you work horses in, which means the ground was sand. It is soft on the hooves and was soft on the camera, the camera just couldn't handle the dirt. The lens is hardly sealed at all so a lot of the sand went into it, and this in turn completely jammed it, this is what I mean by poor manufacturing, even though the camera was, again, OFF, a ton of sand went into the lens. I still have the first camera I ever used which is a, what I like to call "crappy" due to the noise and dead pixels it has, HP. It does not have a retractable lens, is not the size of a cell phone, and because of both of these features, it is incredibly durable, my mother had it since 2003 and bought it used from someone whom I don't know how many years they used it for, and gave it to me in 2007 when I was 12. The image quality was probably superb in its days, but now it is really bad and nothing compared to modern cameras, but it would be fantastic if they could combine durability and image quality, I would buy that camera for sure. I am extremely disappointed that they have sacrificed durability for image quality. I guess I'll have to use my crappy HP until I find a higher quality and durable alternative. I really hope Canon sees my review and puts it to good use, until then, I would not recommend this camera for outdoorsy people or people who just get down and dirty, as this camera can't handle it.For durability, I recommend these two cameras:Fujifilm FinePix Z30 10MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Black)Hewlett Packard PhotoSmart 315 2MP Digital CameraIf you have any other durable camera suggestions, let me know. Might start collecting them since they are such a rarity. :)
